right, and you'll see that the 10th reply actually contains the answer to your question.
again, that is not relevant to my problem.  I saw a post on the Ubuntu forums that almost was, but all my files seem to reside in /etc/alternatives/ and not /usr/lib/
/etc/alternatives/ is a directory that redirects program files symbolically to their real location, so that the main program directory can access them even if they get upgraded
you wouldn't actually find anything other than symbolic links in there
I didn't know that!  That solves the problem actually, as these symbolic links have now lead me to the directory that contains Java.  Thanks a bunch.
you're quite welcome
